label: Pore infillings
definition: Including pseudomycelium of carbonates or opal.

label: Soft segregation (or soft accumulation)
definition: Differs from the surrounding soil mass in colour and composition but is not easily separated as a discrete body.

label: Residual rock fragment
definition: Discrete impregnated body still showing rock structure.

label: Nodul
definition: Discrete body without an internal organization.

label: Concretio
definition: A discrete body with a concentric internal structure, generally cemented.

label: Brok
definition: Discontinuous

label: Irregular
definition: Pockets more deep than wide

label: Smooth
definition: Nearly plane surface

label: Wavy
definition: Pockets less deep than wide

label: Very thick
definition: > 20mm

label: Medium
definition: 2mm–5mm

label: Thick
definition: 5mm–20mm

label: Thi
definition: < 2mm

label: Moderat
definition: Moderate Clear evidence of removal of surface horizons. Original biotic functions partly destroyed.

label: Slight
definition: Slight Some evidence of damage to surface horizons. Original biotic functions largely intact.

label: Sever
definition: Severe Surface horizons completely removed and subsurface horizons exposed. Original biotic functions largely destroyed.

label: Extrem
definition: Extreme Substantial removal of deeper subsurface horizons (badlands). Original biotic functions fully destroyed.

label: Slightly hard
definition: Weakly resistant to pressure; easily broken between thumb and forefinger.

label: soft to slightly hard
definition: soft to slightly hard

label: Very hard
definition: Very hard Very resistant to pressure; can be broken in the hands only with difficulty.

label: Soft
definition: Soil mass is very weakly coherent and fragile; breaks to powder or individual grains under very slight pressure.

label: Loos
definition: Non-coherent.

label: slightly hard to hard
definition: slightly hard to hard

label: Hard
definition: Moderately resistant to pressure; can be broken in the hands; not breakable between thumb and forefinger.

label: Extremely hard
definition: Extremely resistant to pressure; cannot be broken in the hands.

label: hard to very hard
definition: hard to very hard

label: Faint
definition: Surface of coating shows only little contrast in colour, smoothness or any other property to the adjacent surface. Fine sand grains are readily apparent in the cutan. Lamellae are less than 2 mm thick.

label: Prominent
definition: Surface of coatings contrasts strongly in smoothness or colour with the adjacent surfaces. Outlines of fine sand grains are not visible. Lamellae are more than 5 mm thick.

label: Distinct
definition: Surface of coating is distinctly smoother or different in colour from the adjacent surface. Fine sand grains are enveloped in the coating but their outlines are still visible. Lamellae are 2–5 mm thick.

label: hard cemented layer or layers of gypsum (less than 10 cm thick)
“gazha” (clayey water-saturated layer with high gypsum content)
Routine profile description - no sampling
definition: If soil description is done without sampling.

label: Incomplete descriptio
definition: Certain relevant elements are missing from the description, an insufficient number of samples was collected, or the reliability of the analytical data does not permit a complete characterization of the soil. However, the description is useful for specific purposes and provides a satisfactory indication of the nature of the soil at high levels of soil taxonomic classification.

label: Soil augering description - no sampling
definition: If soil description is done without sampling.

label: Soil augering descriptio
definition: Soil augerings do no permit a comprehensive soil profile description. Augerings are made for routine soil observation and identification in soil mapping, and for that purpose normally provide a satisfactory indication of the soil characteristics. Soil samples may be collected from augerings.

label: Reference profile description - no sampling
definition: If soil description is done without sampling.

label: Other descriptions
definition: Essential elements are missing from the description, preventing a satisfactory soil characterization and classification.

label: Routine profile descriptio
definition: No essential elements are missing from the description, sampling or analysis. The number of samples collected is sufficient to characterize all major soil horizons, but may not allow precise definition of all subhorizons, especially in the deeper soil. The profile depth is 80 cm or more, or down to a C or R horizon or layer, which may be shallower. Additional augering and sampling may be required for lower level classification.

label: Reference profile descriptio
definition: No essential elements or details are missing from the description, sampling or analysis. The accuracy and reliability of the description and analytical results permit the full characterization of all soil horizons to a depth of 125 cm, or more if required for classification, or down to a C or R horizon or layer, which may be shallower.

label: Incomplete description - no sampling
definition: If soil description is done without sampling.

label: Fresh or slightly weathered
definition: Fragments show little or no signs of weathering.

label: Weathered
definition: Partial weathering is indicated by discoloration and loss of crystal form in the outer parts of the fragments while the centres remain relatively fresh and the fragments have lost little of their original strength.

label: Strongly weathered
definition: All but the most resistant minerals are weathered, strongly discoloured and altered throughout the fragments, which tend to disintegrate under only moderate pressure.

label: Fi
definition: 2mm–6mm

label: Coars
definition: > 20mm

label: Very fi
definition: < 2mm

label: Medium
definition: 6mm–20mm

label: Artefacts
definition: (mm)

label: Fine gravel
definition: 2mm–6mm

label: Stones
definition: 60mm–200mm

label: Very fine artefacts
definition: < 2mm

label: Fine artefacts
definition: 2mm–6mm

label: Boulders
definition: 60mm–200mm

label: Medium gravel
definition: 6mm–20mm

label: Coarse artefacts
definition: > 20mm

label: Rock fragments
definition: (mm)

label: Medium artefacts
definition: 6mm–20mm

label: Coarse gravel
definition: 20mm–60mm

label: hard cemented layer or layers of carbonates (less than 10 cm thick)
pseudomycelia* (carbonate infillings in pores, resembling mycelia)
Firm
definition: Soil material crushes under moderate pressure between thumb and forefinger, but resistance is distinctly noticeable.

label: Very firm
definition: Soil material crushes under strong pressures; barely crushable between thumb and forefinger.

label: Extremely firm
definition: Soil material crushes only under very strong pressure; cannot be crushed between thumb and forefinger.

label: Friabl
definition: Soil material crushes easily under gentle to moderate pressure between thumb and forefinger, and coheres when pressed together.

label: Very friabl
definition: Soil material crushes under very gentle pressure, but coheres when pressed together.

label: Loos
definition: Non-coherent.

label: Sample disintegrates into numerous fragments after application of weak pressure.
definition: Loamy soils with high clay content, clayey soils. When dropped, sample disintegrates into few fragments, further disintegration of subfragments after application of mild pressure.

label: Very large pressure necessary to force knife into the soil, no further disintegration of sample.
definition: Loamy soils with high clay content, clayey soils. Sample remains intact when dropped, no further disintegration after application of very large pressure.

label: Knife can be pushed into the moist soil with weak pressure, sample disintegrates into few fragments, which may be further divided.
definition: Loamy soils with high clay content, clayey soils. Sample remains mostly intact when dropped, further disintegration possible after application of large pressure.

label: Knife penetrates only 1–2 cm into the moist soil, some effort required, sample disintegrates into few fragments, which cannot be subdivided further.
definition: Loamy soils with high clay content, clayey soils. Sample remains intact when dropped, no further disintegration after application of very large pressure.

label: Many pores, moist materials drop easily out of the auger.
definition: materials with vesicular pores, mineral soils with andic properties. Sample disintegrates at the instant of sampling, many pores visible onthe pit wall. Sample disintegrates at the instant of sampling, many pores visible on the pit wall. Loamy soils with high clay content, clayey soils When dropped, sample disintegrates into numerous fragments, further disintegration of subfragments after application of weak pressure.

definition: < 2 mm (number)0;> 2 mm (number)0

definition: < 2 mm (number)1–20 ;> 2 mm (number)1–2

definition: < 2 mm (number)20–50;> 2 mm (number) 2–5

definition: < 2 mm (number)50–200 ;> 2 mm (number)5–20

definition: 2mm–5mm

definition: 5mm–20mm

label: Very thick
definition: > 20mm

label: Thi
definition: < 2mm

label: Slickensides, predominantly intersecting (Slickensides are polished and grooved ped surfaces that are produced by aggregates sliding one past another.)

Hypodermic coatings (Hypodermic coatings, as used here, are field-scale features, commonly only expressed as hydromorphic features. Micromorphological hypodermic coatings include non-redox features [Bullock et al., 1985].)
Available water capacity - volumetric (FC to WP)
Bottom (drainage line)
definition: Position in flat or almost flat terrain: Bottom (drainage line)

label: Middle slope (back slope)
definition: Position in undulating to mountainous terrain: Middle slope (back slope)

label: Intermediate part (talf)
definition: Position in flat or almost flat terrain: Intermediate part (talf)

label: Lower part (and dip)
definition: Position in flat or almost flat terrain: Lower part (and dip)

label: Upper slope (shoulder)
definition: Position in undulating to mountainous terrain: Upper slope (shoulder)

label: Bottom (flat)
definition: Position in undulating to mountainous terrain: Bottom (flat)

label: Lower slope (foot slope)
definition: Position in undulating to mountainous terrain: Lower slope (foot slope)

label: Higher part (rise)
definition: Position in flat or almost flat terrain: Higher part (rise)

label: Crest (summit)
definition: Position in undulating to mountainous terrain: Crest (summit)

label: Toe slop
definition: Position in undulating to mountainous terrain: Toe slope

label: Hard
definition: Cannot be broken in the fingers.

label: Soft
definition: Can be broken between forefinger and thumb nail

label: Distinct
definition: Although not striking, the mottles are readily seen. The hue, chroma and value of the matrix are easily distinguished from those of the mottles. They may vary by as much as 2.5 units of hue or several units in chroma or value.

label: Prominent
definition: The mottles are conspicuous and mottling is one of the outstanding features of the horizon. Hue, chroma and value alone or in combination are at least several units apart.

label: Faint
definition: The mottles are evident only on close examination. Soil colours in both the matrix and mottles have closely related hues, chromas and values.

label: Plastic
definition: Wire formable but breaks if bent into a ring; slight to moderate force required for deformation of the soil mass.

label: Very plastic
definition: Wire formable and can be bent into a ring; moderately strong to very strong force required for deformation of the soil mass.

label: Slightly plastic
definition: Wire formable but breaks immediately if bent into a ring; soil mass deformed by very slight force.

label: Non-plastic
definition: No wire is formable.

label: Termite or ant channels and nests
Sticky
definition: After pressure, soil material adheres to both thumb and finger and tends to stretch somewhat and pull apart rather than pulling free from either digit.

label: Non-sticky
definition: After release of pressure, practically no soil material adheres to thumb and finger.

label: Slightly sticky
definition: After pressure, soil material adheres to both thumb and finger but comes off one or the other rather cleanly. It is not appreciably stretched when the digits are separated.

label: Very sticky
definition: After pressure, soil material adheres strongly to both thumb and finger and is decidedly stretched when they are separated.

label: Nodular
definition: The layer is largely constructed from cemented nodules or concretions of irregular shape.

label: Pisolithic
definition: The layer is largely constructed from cemented spherical nodules.

label: Vesicular
definition: The layer has large, equidimensional voids that may be filled with uncemented material.

label: Platy
definition: The compacted or cemented parts are platelike and have a horizontal or subhorizontal orientation.

label: Mine (surface, including openpit, gravel and quarries)
Accelerated and natural erosion not distinguished
Active in recent past
definition: Active in recent past (previous 50–100 years)

label: Older Pleistocene, with periglacial influenc
definition: Older Pleistocene, with periglacial influence, commonly the recent soil formation on younger over older, preweathered materials.

label: Very young anthropogeomorphic
definition: Very young (1–10 years) anthropogeomorphic: with complete disturbance of natural surfaces (and soils) such as in urban, industrial and mining areas with very early soil development from fresh natural or technogenic or mixed materials.

label: Very young natural
definition: Very young (1–10 years) natural: with loss by erosion or deposition of materials such as on tidal flats, of coastal dunes, in river valleys, landslides or desert areas.

label: Holocene natural
definition: Holocene (100–10 000 years) natural: with loss by erosion or deposition of materials such as on tidal flats, of coastal dunes, in river valleys, landslides or desert areas.

label: Young anthropogeomorphic
definition: Young (10–100 years) anthropogeomorphic: with complete disturbance of any natural surfaces (and soils) such as in urban, industrial and mining areas with early soil development from fresh natural, technogenic or a mixture of materials, or restriction of flooding by dykes.

label: Young natural
definition: Young (10–100 years) natural: with loss by erosion or deposition of materials such as on tidal flats, of coastal dunes, river valleys, landslides or desert areas.

label: Holocene anthropogeomorphic
definition: Holocene (100–10 000 years) anthropogeomorphic: human-made relief modifications, such as terracing of forming hills or walls by early civilizations or during the Middle Ages or earlier, restriction of flooding by dykes, or surface raising.

label: Older Pleistocene, ice covered
definition: Older Pleistocene, ice covered, commonly the recent soil formation on younger over older, preweathered materials.

label: Late Pleistocene, periglacial
definition: Late Pleistocene, periglacial, commonly recent soil formation on preweathered materials.

label: Older Pleistocene, without periglacial influence.
definition: Older Pleistocene, without periglacial influence.

label: Late Pleistocene, ice covered
definition: Late Pleistocene, ice covered, commonly recent soil formation on fresh materials.

label: Older, pre-Tertiary land surfaces
definition: Older, pre-Tertiary land surfaces, commonly high planes, terraces or peneplains, except incised valleys, frequent occurrence of palaeosoils.

label: Late Pleistocene, without periglacial influence.
definition: Late Pleistocene, without periglacial influence.

label: Tertiary land surfaces
definition: Tertiary land surfaces, commonly high planes, terraces or peneplains, except incised valleys, frequent occurrence of palaeosoils.

label: Vesicular
definition: Discontinuous spherical or elliptical voids (chambers) of sedimentary origin or formed by compressed air, e.g. gas bubbles in slaking crusts after heavy rainfall. Relatively unimportant in connection with plant growth.

label: Planes
definition: Most planes are extra-pedal voids, related to accommodating ped surfaces or cracking patterns. They are often not persistent and vary in size, shape and quantity depending on the moisture condition of the soil. Planar voids may be recorded, describing width and frequency.

label: Vughs
definition: Mostly irregular, equidimensional voids of faunal origin or resulting from tillage or disturbance of other voids. Discontinuous or interconnected. May be quantified in specific cases.

label: Channels
definition: Elongated voids of faunal or floral origin, mostly tubular in shape and continuous, varying strongly in diameter. When wider than a few centimetres (burrow holes), they are more adequately described under biological activity.

label: Interstitial
definition: Controlled by the fabric, or arrangement, of the soil particles, also known as textural voids. Subdivision possible into simple packing voids, which relate to the packing of sand particles, and compound packing voids, which result from the packing of non-accommodating peds. Predominantly irregular in shape and interconnected, and hard to quantify in the field.

label: Non-cemented and non-compacted
definition: Neither cementation nor compaction observed (slakes in water).

label: Indurated
definition: Cemented mass cannot be broken by body weight (75-kg standard soil scientist) (more than 90 percent of soil mass).

label: Moderately cemented
definition: Cemented mass cannot be broken in the hands but is discontinuous (less than 90 percent of soil mass).

label: Weakly cemented
definition: Cemented mass is brittle and hard, but can be broken in the hands.

label: Cemented
definition: Cemented mass cannot be broken in the hands and is continuous (more than 90 percent of soil mass).

label: Compacted but non-cemented
definition: Compacted mass is appreciably harder or more brittle than other comparable soil mass (slakes in water).

label: o rain in the last week
definition: Former weather conditions (Ad-hoc-AG-Boden, 2005)

label: xtremely rainy time or snow melting
definition: Former weather conditions (Ad-hoc-AG-Boden, 2005)

label: sunny/clear
definition: Present weather conditions (Schoeneberger et al., 2002)

label: sleet
definition: Present weather conditions (Schoeneberger et al., 2002)

label: o rain in the last 24 hours
definition: Former weather conditions (Ad-hoc-AG-Boden, 2005)

label: o rain in the last month
definition: Former weather conditions (Ad-hoc-AG-Boden, 2005)

label: rai
definition: Present weather conditions (Schoeneberger et al., 2002)

label: overcast
definition: Present weather conditions (Schoeneberger et al., 2002)

label: snow
definition: Present weather conditions (Schoeneberger et al., 2002)

label: rainy without heavy rain in the last 24 hours
definition: Former weather conditions (Ad-hoc-AG-Boden, 2005)

label: partly cloudy
definition: Present weather conditions (Schoeneberger et al., 2002)

label: heavier rain for some days or rainstorm in the last 24 hours
definition: Former weather conditions (Ad-hoc-AG-Boden, 2005)

label: Moderately gypsiric
definition: ≈ 5–15 EC = > 1.8 dS m-1 in 10 g soil/250 ml H2O

label: Strongly gypsiric
definition: ≈ 15–60 higher amounts may be differentiated by abundance of H2O-soluble pseudomycelia/crystals and soil colour

label: Slightly gypsiric
definition: ≈ 0–5 EC = < 1.8 dS m-1 in 10 g soil/250 ml H2O

label: Non-gypsiric
definition: 0 EC = < 0.18 dS m-1 in 10 g soil/250 ml H2O

label: Abrupt
definition: 0cm–2cm

label: Clear
definition: 2cm–5cm

label: Diffus
definition: > 15cm

label: Gradual
definition: 5cm–15cm

label: ≈ > 25 Extremely calcareous Extremely strong reaction. Thick foam forms quickly.
≈ 0–2 Slightly calcareous Audible effervescence but not visible.
0 Non-calcareous No detectable visible or audible effervescence.
≈ 10–25 Strongly calcareous Strong visible effervescence. Bubbles form a low foam.

definition: < 2 mm (number)1–20 ;> 2 mm (number)1–2

label: No
definition: < 2 mm (number)0;> 2 mm (number)0

label: Few
definition: < 2 mm (number)20–50;> 2 mm (number) 2–5

label: Brok
definition: The layer is less than 50 percent cemented or compacted, and shows a rather irregular appearance.

label: Discontinuous
definition: The layer is 50–90 percent cemented or compacted, and in general shows a regular appearance.

label: Continuous
definition: The layer is more than 90 percent cemented or compacted, and is only interrupted in places by cracks or fissures.

label: Large boulders
definition: 60cm–200cm

label: Coarse gravel
definition: 2cm–6cm

label: Boulders
definition: 20cm–60cm

label: Stones
definition: 6cm–20cm

label: Moderate to strong
definition: Moderate to strong

label: Weak to moderat
definition: Weak to moderate

label: Moderat
definition: Aggregates are observable in place and there is a distinct arrangement of natural surfaces of weakness. When disturbed, the soil material breaks into a mixture of many entire aggregates, some broken aggregates, and little material without aggregates faces. Aggregates surfaces generally show distinct differences with the aggregates interiors.

label: Strong
definition: Aggregates are clearly observable in place and there is a prominent arrangement of natural surfaces of weakness. When disturbed, the soil material separates mainly into entire aggregates. Aggregates surfaces generally differ markedly from aggregate interiors.

label: Weak
definition: Aggregates are barely observable in place and there is only a weak arrangement of natural surfaces of weakness. When gently disturbed, the soil material breaks into a mixture of few entire aggregates, many broken aggregates, and much material without aggregate faces. Aggregate surfaces differ in some way from the aggregate interior.

label: Stone li
definition: any content, but concentrated at a distinct depth of a horizon
